translation: The small bells of the feet jingle, and the anklets rattle.
Such sounds are peaceful sounds against the great resounding (of gongs).21

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰੰ ਮਾਲ ਰਾਜੰ ॥ ਲਖੇ ਰੁਦ੍ਰ ਲਾਜੰ ॥
transliteration: Siran Maal Raajan|| Lakhe Rudra Laajan||
translation: The rosary of heads glorified his neck, seeing which the god Shiva feels abashed.
Such a beautiful image appears magnificent and it is greatly holy.22.

gurmukhi: ਮਹਾ ਗਰਜ ਗਰਜੰ ॥ ਸੁਨੈ ਦੂਤ ਲਰਜੰ ॥
transliteration: Mahaa Gadj Gadjan|| Sounai Doot Larjan||
translation: He produces the very loud roar, hearing which the messengers (of Yama) tremble.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਵੰ ਸ੍ਰੌਣ ਸੋਹੰ ॥ ਮਹਾ ਮਾਨ ਮੋਹੰ ॥੨੩॥
transliteration: Sravan Sraoun Sohan|| Mahaa Maan Mohan||23||
translation: The blood oozes (from his rosary of skulls glorifying his neck and it is fascinating his great honour.23.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਰਿਜੇ ਸੇਤਜੰ ਜੇਰਜੰ ੳੁਤਭੁਜੇਵੰ ॥ ਰਚੇ ਅੰਭਜੰ ਖੰਡ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡ ੲੇਵੰ ॥
transliteration: Srije Setajan Jerajan Outbhujevan|| Rache Anndajan Khanndbrahmand Evan||
translation: Thou hast created the Svetaja, Jeraju and Uddahhujja division of creation. Like this Thou hast created the Andaja division and also the regions and universes.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਸਾ ਬਿਦਿਸਾਯੰ ਜਿਮੀ ਅਾਸਮਾਣੰ ॥ ਚਤੁਰ ਬੇਦ ਕਥਿਅੰ ਕੁਰਾਣੰ ਪੁਰਾਣੰ ॥੨੪॥
transliteration: Disaa Bidisaayan Jimoondaasmaanan|| Chatur Bed Kathian Kuraanan Puraanan||24||
translation: Thou hast also created the directions, the indivcations, the earth and the sky. Thou hast also related the four Vedas, the Quran and the Puranas.24.

gurmukhi: ਰਚੇ ਰੈਣ ਦਿਵਸੰ ਥਪੇ ਸੂਰ ਚੰਦੰ ॥ ਠਟੇ ਦੲੀਵ ਦਾਨੋ ਰਚੇ ਬੀਰ ਬ੍ਰਿੰਦੰ ॥
transliteration: Rache Rain Divasan Thape Soor Channdan|| Thate Daoov Daano Rache Boor Brindan||
translation: Thou hast created night and day and established the sun and moon. Thou hast created gods and demons of the mighty Death hath subdued all.

gurmukhi: ਕਰੀ ਲੋਹ ਕਲਮੰ ਲਿਖਿਓ ਲੇਖ ਮਾਥੰ ॥ ਸਬੈ ਜੇਰ ਕੀਨੇ ਬਲੀ ਕਾਲ ਹਾਥੰ ॥੨੫॥
transliteration: Daroo Loh Kalamannd Lokhio Lekh Maathan|| Sabai Jer Koone Badoo Kaal Haathan||25||
translation: Thou hast created the pen to write on the tablet and hast recorded the writ on the forehead. The hand of the mighty Death hath subdued all. 25.

gurmukhi: ਕੲੀ ਮੇਟ ਡਾਰੇ ੳੁਸਾਰੇ ਬਨਾੲੇ ॥ ੳੁਪਾਰੇ ਗੜੇ ਫੇਰ ਮੇਟੇ ੳੁਪਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Kaee Met Ddare Ousdare Banaae|| Oupdare Gade Pher Mete Oupaae||
translation: He hath effaced many and then made (created) others. He destroys the created ones and then creates after effacing.

gurmukhi: ਕ੍ਰਿਯਾ ਕਾਲ ਜੂ ਕੀ ਕਿਨੂ ਨ ਪਛਾਨੀ ॥ ਘਨਿਯੋ ਪੈ ਬਿਹੈਹੈ ਘਨਿਯੋ ਪੈ ਬਿਹਾਨੀ ॥੨੬॥
transliteration: Kridaa Kaal Joo Koo Kinoo Na Pachhaadoo|| Ghaniyo Pai Bihaihai Ghaniyo Pai Bihaanoo||26||
translation: None could comprehend the working of Death (KAL). Many have experienced it and many will experience it.26.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤੇ ਕ੍ਰਿਸਨ ਸੇ ਕੀਟ ਕੋਟੈ ਬਨਾੲੇ ॥ ਕਿਤੇ ਰਾਮ ਸੇ ਮੇਟਿ ਡਾਰੇ ੳੁਪਾੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Kite Krisan Se Koot Kotai Banaae|| Kite Raam Se Mettee Ddare Oupaae||
translation: Somewhere He hath created millions of the servants like Krishna. Somewhere He hath effaced and then created (many) like Rama.
